info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 7:47PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Reduced Visibility through Thursday Morning... Low clouds and areas of fog have settled in across portions of the Hi-Line this evening, with these low clouds and fog expected to persist through Thursday morning before slowly dissipating into the afternoon hours. While most locations will see reductions in visibility to as low as one to three miles in the areas of fog, locally dense fog with visibilities as low as one quarter of a mile are possible in prone areas within the Milk River Valley and along the eastern slopes of the Bears Paw Mountains. Travelers should be prepared for changing conditions over short distances. Slippery surfaces are possible across the region given the fog and subfreezing temperatures, especially elevated ones like bridges and overpasses. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.
